attachments.text:
## Proposed Changes

• Added a reusable DateTimeInput component
• Added a Zod schema to validate ISO date-time with timezone
• replaced datetime-local inputs with reusable DateTimeInput component across multiple files
• Fixes <https://github.com/ohcnetwork/care_fe/issues/12360|#12360>

@ohcnetwork/care-fe-code-reviewers

## Merge Checklist

• Add specs that demonstrate bug / test a new feature.
• Update <https://docs.ohc.network|product documentation>.
• Ensure that UI text is kept in I18n files.
• Prep screenshot or demo video for changelog entry, and attach it to issue.
• Request for Peer Reviews
• Completion of QA in Mobile Devices
• Completion of QA in Desktop Devices

## Summary by CodeRabbit

## Summary by CodeRabbit

• *New Features*  
   • Introduced a custom date-time input component with timezone support for forms and data entry.  
   • Added a validator to ensure date-time strings include timezone information.
• *Refactor*  
   • Replaced native date-time inputs across multiple forms with the new custom component for improved consistency and timezone handling.  
   • Updated form validation and state management to use ISO date-time strings with timezone awareness.
attachments.title: #12364  Added a reusable DateTimeInput component

attachments.fallback: #12394 Avatar Upload Does Not Show Selected Image After Validation Error
attachments.text:
*Describe the bug*

When a user uploads an image that exceeds the maximum width, the system shows an error message. But, if the user tries to select the same image again, the image is not displayed in the selection dialog.  
For user convenience, the selected image should still be visible (even if invalid) instead of appearing blank.

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Go to Profile
2. Click "Change Avatar" → "Upload an image"
3. Select a large image, error will show,But
4. Click "Upload an image" again and select the same image.
5. The dialog shows no image.
issue-1.2.mp4 

*Expected behavior*

The selected image should always appear in the preview dialog—even if invalid—so users can visually confirm the issue and choose a replacement if needed.

16-fix.mp4 

*Screenshots*  
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

*Desktop (please complete the following information):*

• OS: [e.g. iOS]
• Browser [e.g. chrome, safari]
• Version [e.g. 22]

*Smartphone (please complete the following information):*

• Device: [e.g. iPhone6]
• OS: [e.g. iOS8.1]
• Browser [e.g. stock browser, safari]
• Version [e.g. 22]

*Additional context*  
Add any other context about the problem here.

---

*Additional Context:*  
Include any other relevant context, links, screenshots, or resources that support your proposed solution.

> :rotating_light: Your assignment may be unassigned if there is no activity or progress within the stated timeline unless communicated clearly and agreed upon.

attachments.text:
*Describe the bug*  
In a system where multiple cameras are present, users are unable to switch to preferred camera when multiple cameras are available in system

*To Reproduce*  
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Have multiple cameras in your system (maybe configure OBS Virtual Camera if you have OBS)
2. Open File Uploads of a Patient/Encounter or use Avatar Edit of Facility/User.
3. Observe there's no way we can switch to another preferred camera.

*Expected behavior*  
If there are multiple cameras in system, users should be able to select the preferred camera (applicable for all places where this feature is used)

*Screenshots*

<https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/25143503/413600731-7c46a447-d6d8-413f-b890-df73d0861de5.png?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..AmQwU_axlcmCFuNjsnf1CQcOUTH5wylXJayoxUiLRuc|[Image](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/25143503/413600731-7c46a447-d6d8-413f-b890-df73d0861de5.png?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..AmQwU_axlcmCFuNjsnf1CQcOUTH5wylXJayoxUiLRuc)>
attachments.title: #10629 Add support for switching to preferred camera when multiple cameras are available in system
